title: Kidney transplant patient misses flight; Shinde offers seat on chartered plane - watch video
content: Eknath Shinde, the Deputy Chief Minister, stepped in to help a kidney transplant patient from Jalgaon who missed her flight to Mumbai. Shinde arranged for her to travel on his chartered plane late Friday night. After a program delay, Shinde ensured the pilots could fly by coordinating medical check-ups, enabling the flight to depart around 9:50 pm.

title: Murshidabad violence: Father-son dragged out, killed in front of family, says charge sheet
content: In Murshidabad, Haragobindo Das and his son Chandan Das were brutally murdered during communal violence sparked by protests over the Waqf (Amendment) Act. A chargesheet filed in Jangipur court names 13 accused, detailing charges of murder, rioting, and house-trespass. The unrest, lasting several days, prompted the deployment of Central Armed Police Forces after large-scale arson and destruction.

title: Meghalaya murder: MP CM Mohan Yadav seeks CBI probe; search on for Indore woman
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has urged Home Minister Amit Shah for a CBI investigation into the disappearance of an Indore couple in Meghalaya. While Raja Rajuvanshi was found dead, his wife, Sonam, remains missing, prompting a murder investigation. Despite challenging weather, extensive search operations involving multiple agencies are underway to locate Sonam, with drones being deployed to aid the efforts.

title: Tech jobs: Microsoft CEO's advice for Computer Science students; All of us..
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advises aspiring tech professionals to prioritize computational thinking fundamentals, even with AI's growing influence. He emphasizes the importance of logically breaking down problems and designing systematic solutions. Nadella also revealed that AI now contributes significantly to Microsoft's code, writing up to 30% of it.

title: 'You are not going to get rid of chokers tag': Mark Boucher
content: Former South Africa coach Mark Boucher believes a World Test Championship (WTC) victory against Australia could revitalize Test cricket in South Africa. Despite criticism, Boucher highlights South Africa's consistent performance leading to the final. He acknowledges the 'chokers' tag but emphasizes the WTC's different dynamic.

title: 'Completely absurd': EC gives 6-point rebuttal to Rahul's 'polls rigged' claim
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has strongly refuted Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's allegations of "match-fixing" in elections, deeming them "completely absurd." The ECI defended the integrity of the electoral process, emphasizing the presence of political party representatives at every stage. They highlighted the meticulous preparation of electoral rolls and the lack of substantiated complaints during the Maharashtra assembly elections.

title: Too many emails? Google AI CEO says he’d pay big to get rid of them: ‘The thing…'
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis is developing an AI-powered email system to alleviate the burden of inbox management. Hassabis expressed his desire to eliminate emails, even at a high cost, and his team is actively creating a tool that sorts, replies, and ensures important messages are addressed.

title: Russia unveils tech for launching drones from space station
content: Russia has developed a groundbreaking technology for automated spacecraft launches and robotic maintenance from orbital stations, a world first. This innovation will be tested on the upcoming Russian Orbital Station (ROS) and later utilized in lunar missions. Deployment of the ROS, envisioned as a robotic drone platform, is slated between 2027 and 2033, following the ISS deorbiting.

title: Once a rebel, always a rebel? Congress's Tharoor dilemma
content: Shashi Tharoor, a prominent figure in the Congress party, has often challenged the party's high command, advocating for internal reforms and questioning his role within the organization. His actions, including contesting the presidential election and publicly praising government policies, have created friction with party leaders.

title: 'Honeymoon tragedy': Meghalaya deploys drones to trace Indore woman
content: In Meghalaya, drones are aiding the search for a missing woman from Indore, Sonam Rajbanshi, amidst challenging weather conditions, while the investigation into her husband's murder proceeds. The couple was on their honeymoon in Sohra. Opposition Leader Mukul Sangma urges increased CCTV surveillance and implementation of the Meghalaya Residents, Safety and Security Act, emphasizing the need for heightened vigilance.

title: Google's next CEO: Pichai hints at AI leadership; future boss will have AI companion
content: Sundar Pichai envisions a future Google CEO empowered by an extraordinary AI companion, reflecting the company's deep AI integration. He emphasizes AI as a tool to amplify human productivity, not replace workers, citing his own experimentation with AI coding assistants. Google prepares for a future where AI and human executives collaborate closely, reshaping leadership and work.

title: Sonia Gandhi taken to hospital in Shimla; stable: Himachal CM's advisor
content: Sonia Gandhi, the former Congress president, was taken to a hospital in Shimla for a routine health check-up after experiencing minor health issues during her visit. Doctors are currently examining her, and she is reported to be in stable condition. This incident occurs a few months after she was hospitalized in Delhi for stomach-related problems.

title: YouTuber Jasbir Singh sent to 2-day police remand on charges of spying for Pak
content: YouTuber Jasbir Singh, accused of spying for Pakistan, was remanded to two-day police custody by a Mohali court. The Punjab Police's SSOC sought further remand to seize his laptop and investigate alleged links to a spy network involving YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and a Pakistani official. Singh's lawyer claims he was falsely implicated after cooperating with the police.

title: MP shocker: Dog drags newborn from hospital toilet in its jaws; probe begins
content: In Mhow, Madhya Pradesh, a stray dog was found carrying a newborn's body near a government hospital toilet. Hospital authorities and police are investigating after a security guard discovered the scene early Saturday. CCTV footage suggests a 17-year-old girl, admitted for colic pain, may have delivered the baby in the toilet and fled with a man.

title: 'Everything went dark': Crash leaves Maha biker with 33 glass pieces in throat
content: In a miraculous recovery, a 20-year-old college student regained his voice after a severe accident in Chakan. He crashed his two-wheeler into a pickup truck, embedding 33 glass pieces in his throat. Doctors at a private hospital successfully removed the glass during a critical surgery, repairing damaged blood vessels and nerves near his voice box.

title: Fans question if Hailee Steinfeld is committed to Josh Allen after just days of marriage
content: Josh Allen is navigating playful fan reactions after a lighthearted red carpet interaction between his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, and actor Michael B. Jordan went viral. Despite the teasing, Allen and Steinfeld, who recently married in a lavish ceremony, appear to be in a strong and supportive relationship, with Allen's focus remaining on the upcoming NFL season.

title: G7 Summit: Canada got 'strong push from G6 to have India at table'
content: Amidst strained relations, Canada invited India to the G7 summit, driven by pressure from other G6 nations seeking stronger strategic partnerships with India. Despite past tensions, India's economic significance and commitment to law enforcement dialogue were key factors in the invitation. Canada aims to demonstrate global relevance through diplomacy.

title: Musk vs Trump: Tesla CEO deletes 'Epstein files' tweet; a bid to mend ties?
content: Elon Musk appears to be softening his stance towards Donald Trump, deleting critical tweets, prompting calls for a full apology from James Fishback. This follows a public spat where Musk criticized Trump's legislative efforts, leading to Trump threatening to end government subsidies for Musk's companies. Musk retaliated by reposting unverified claims about Trump's connection to Jeffrey Epstein, escalating the feud.

title: Sergei Bobrovsky becomes first goalie in NHL history with back-to-back 40-save games
content: Sergei Bobrovsky is making NHL history in the Stanley Cup Final, becoming the first goalie to open the series with consecutive 40-save games. As he leads the Florida Panthers toward glory, Philadelphia Flyers fans are left reliving a trade they’d rather forget watching their former goalie thrive while their own goaltending carousel spins endlessly.

title: Norway Chess: Muzychuk, with much less hype, earns as much as Carlsen
content: Anna Muzychuk, Ukraine's top Grandmaster, secured the Norway Chess Women title. She remained unbeaten in classical games. Muzychuk amassed 16.5 points, edging out competitors. She also received equal prize money of NOK 700,000. This victory highlights her consistent performance in women’s chess. The tournament featured a unique format with Armageddon tiebreaks. Muzychuk's strategic gameplay led to her success in Stavanger.

title: Tapping out: Kabul may be first modern city to run out of water
content: Kabul is facing a severe water crisis, potentially becoming the first modern city to completely run out of water. Groundwater extraction far exceeds natural replenishment, with aquifers projected to dry up by 2030, potentially displacing millions. Contamination, infrastructure issues, and climate change exacerbate the problem, forcing families into debt.

title: 'Your love & God's grace kept me safe': Tejashwi reacts after convoy accident
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav escaped unharmed after his convoy was hit by an uncontrolled truck and car in Vaishali district. Three security personnel were injured and hospitalized in Patna. Yadav attributed his safety to "people's love and God's grace.

title: Fans in disbelief after New York Giants rookie Skattebo fails to recognize NFL legends
content: New York Giants rookie Cameron Skattebo faced criticism. A video showed him struggling to identify NFL legends. This sparked debate among fans on Reddit. Some were angry, others empathetic. The discussion broadened to generational gaps in NFL knowledge. Fans discussed the transience of fame. Skattebo's experience highlights the importance of understanding NFL history.

title: Odisha: Cops caught dancing drunk at collector's residence, suspended
content: In Balasore, Odisha, five police officers were suspended after a video surfaced showing them partying and drinking alcohol while on duty at the District Collector's residence. The incident occurred on June 1 while the Collector was away, raising concerns about security protocols. An investigation is underway, and further disciplinary actions are expected following the probe.

title: Suspecting affair, Bengaluru man beheads wife after quarrel; surrenders to cops
content: In a shocking incident near Bengaluru, Shankar allegedly beheaded his wife, Manasa, due to suspicions of infidelity. Following a heated argument at their home, Shankar used a sickle to commit the gruesome act. He then rode to the police station with her severed head to surrender, confessing to the crime, leading to his immediate arrest and ongoing investigation.

title: Kash Patel reveals how India is helping America with fentanyl crisis
content: Patel said that he had personally reached out to Indian officials and that joint operations between the FBI and Indian law enforcement were now underway. “I literally just got off the phone with the Indian government,” he said. “I said, I need your help. This stuff’s coming into your country and then they’re moving it from your country because India is not consuming fentanyl.”

title: Espionage network exposed: Ex-Pak cop-turned-YouTuber groomed influencers for ISI
content: Indian investigators have identified Nasir, a former Pakistan Police sub-inspector turned YouTuber, as a key ISI handler in cross-border espionage. He and Naushaba Shehzad allegedly cultivated Indian influencers, offering visas and luxury accommodations in exchange for pro-Pakistan content. This operation aimed to create a favorable narrative and gather intelligence, with connections leading to expelled officials and arrested YouTubers.

title: 7 Maoists killed in ongoing Bijapur operation, key leaders among those neutralised
content: Security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district have killed seven Maoists, including top leaders Narasimha Chalam alias Sudhakar and Bhaskar alias Mailarapu Adellu, in a series of encounters over three days. The anti-Naxal operation, ongoing in the Indravati National Park, resulted in the recovery of arms and ammunition.

title: 'Deep-rooted terror conspiracy': NIA charges Goldy Brar, 4 in Gurugram clubs bombing case
content: The NIA has filed a chargesheet against five individuals, including designated terrorist Goldy Brar, concerning the Gurgaon club bombings in December 2024. These attacks, targeting Warehouse and Human Clubs, were orchestrated by Babbar Khalsa International to incite communal tensions. Brar and an associate remain at large, while others have been arrested and charged under various acts.

title: Piyush Chawla retires: Yuvraj Singh pens emotional tribute to former mate
content: Following Piyush Chawla's retirement, Yuvraj Singh praised the leg-spinner's impactful career, highlighting his ability to excel under pressure. Singh acknowledged Chawla's resilience, dedication, and contributions to India's 2007 T20 World Cup and 2011 ODI World Cup victories. He further emphasized Chawla's impressive first-class record and IPL achievements, noting his calm demeanor and commitment on the field.

title: 'Following zero-tolerance policy': Jaishankar reasserts stance on terror
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has reaffirmed India's firm stance against terrorism, expressing gratitude to the United Kingdom for their condemnation of the recent terror attack in Pahalgam. He emphasized India's zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism and stressed the expectation that its partners would understand and support this position.

title: 'Lungi, not lathi': 34 arrested after T'gana cop busts farmer loan scam
content: In Telangana's Adilabad, Inspector Bandari Raju cleverly disguised himself as a farmer to bust a loan fraud racket. Donning a lungi and towel, he infiltrated the group of agents who were exploiting vulnerable farmers by siphoning off money from their loan amounts.

title: Is water actually wet? Scientists reveal the answer
content: The question of whether water is wet delves into science and philosophy, exploring definitions of wetness. Scientifically, wetness results from a liquid's interaction with a solid surface, involving cohesive and adhesive forces. While water makes other things wet, its own wetness depends on the definition used, leading to ongoing debate.

title: Chopper crash-lands near Kedarnath; 4th mishap in 30 days on Char Dham route
content: A helicopter crash-landed in Badasu, Rudraprayag district after taking off from Sirsi helipad. It was en route to Kedarnath with five pilgrims. The tail of the chopper broke during landing. No injuries were reported. This incident marks the fourth helicopter mishap on the Char Dham route within 30 days. DGCA has been notified and shuttle operations continue as scheduled.

title: Bengaluru stampede: KSCA top officials resign; take moral responsibility for 11 deaths
content: Following the tragic stampede at Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium, which resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries, KSCA Secretary A Shankar and Treasurer A E Jairam have resigned. They cited moral responsibility for the incident amid public outcry and an ongoing investigation into crowd management failures during IPL victory celebrations. An FIR has been filed, and the officials sought anticipatory bail.

title: Watch: Sachin surprises Aamir at 'Sitaare Zameen Par' screening; movie releases June 20
content: A viral video captures the heartwarming meeting between Sachin Tendulkar and Aamir Khan at a special screening of 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. Aamir, engrossed in foosball, excitedly greeted Sachin upon his arrival, with the room erupting in chants of the cricket legend's name.

title: 'It could have gone nuclear': Trump again claims he 'stopped India-Pakistan war'
content: Donald Trump has reiterated his claim that his intervention prevented a potential nuclear war between India and Pakistan, asserting he used trade leverage to halt hostilities. This assertion received unexpected support from Russia, with a Putin aide confirming Trump's role. However, Indian officials have pushed back against the mediation claims, directly addressing concerns with US Vice President JD Vance.

title: Peck & Choose: 5 GIB chicks named after Op Sindoor heroes in Rajasthan
content: In Jaisalmer, five Great Indian Bustard chicks have been named after key figures and elements of Operation Sindoor, a military campaign. This initiative by the Wildlife Institute of India honors the Indian forces' valor while highlighting the connection between national defense and wildlife conservation.

title: 'Racist mentality': Iran slams US travel ban; cites 'deep hostility towards Muslims'
content: Tehran has strongly condemned the US travel ban targeting Iranians and citizens of 11 other countries, primarily from the Middle East and Africa, labeling it as a reflection of a "supremacist and racist mentality." This condemnation follows President Trump's executive order reinstating travel restrictions, citing national security concerns after a firebomb attack at a pro-Israel rally in Colorado.

title: Infosys’ new cash reward policy for employees; staff to earn Rs 700 per interview
content: Infosys has launched a cash reward program for senior staff involved in lateral recruitment interviews, aiming to boost employee engagement and attract top talent. The initiative, effective retroactively from January 1, offers financial incentives for conducting interviews, excluding HR and senior leadership.

title: Watch: Is Trump worried about Elon Musk using drugs? Here is what he said
content: The alliance between Donald Trump and Elon Musk has dissolved into a public feud, marked by accusations and rebuttals. Trump addressed concerns about Musk's alleged drug use and the fairness of government subsidies to Tesla. This fallout follows Musk's criticism of Trump's bill, leading to market instability for Tesla and a potential disposal of Trump's Tesla car.

title: 'Stopped for tea break': Tejashwi escapes unhurt after convoy hit by truck in Bihar
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav narrowly escaped injury early Saturday when a speeding truck collided with two vehicles in his convoy in Vaishali district, Bihar. The incident, which occurred around 12:30 am near Goraul on the Patna-Muzaffarpur highway, left three security personnel injured. Yadav, who was returning to Patna from Madhepura, visited the injured at the hospital.

title: Jafrabad double murder: 55 days on, chargesheet names 13
content: Bengal police filed a charge sheet regarding the Murshidabad violence. The violence resulted in the deaths of Harogobindo Das and his son Chandan. A rumour about a mosque attack triggered the incident. Police arrested thirteen individuals from Bengal, Odisha, and Jharkhand. The accused face charges including murder and armed robbery. The Das family seeks a CBI probe.

title: 'Out of Soros’ playbook': BJP slams Rahul over Maha polls 'rigged' claim
content: Amit Malviya has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's allegations of election rigging in Maharashtra, dismissing them as a tactic inspired by George Soros to undermine public trust in institutions. Malviya highlighted the inconsistency in Gandhi's claims, noting the absence of similar concerns when Congress secured victories in Telangana and Karnataka.

title: IND vs ENG: Ponting backs Gill as Test captain, suggests ideal batting spot
content: Ricky Ponting believes Shubman Gill's captaincy is a smart move for India's Test team as they transition post-Rohit and Kohli. He suggests Gill batting at No.4 could ease pressure, with Jaiswal and Sudharsan opening. Ponting is optimistic about India's young talent and advocates for Arshdeep Singh's inclusion in the first Test, citing his skills and suitability to the Dukes ball.

title: Age-old leaky sewer lines increase risk of water contamination in Anna Nagar in Tiruchi
content: Corporation official says a detailed project report will be prepared soon to replace the damaged and old pipes which had become rusty and worn out in the area

title: Govt. asks Commissioners of ULBs in Andhra Pradesh to ensure no person is engaged in manual scavenging
content: Following a directive of the High Court, the Municipal Administration and Urban Development Department directed the Commissioners to ensure strict implementation of the Prohibition of Employment as Manual Scavengers and their Rehabilitation Act, 2013

title: Sonia Gandhi undergoes tests at Shimla hospital after high blood pressure complaint
content: Senior Congress leader was on a personal trip to Shimla along with her daughter Priyanka Gandhi; underwent some tests at the hospital and later left, according to the media advisor to Himachal Pradesh CM

title: Madhya Pradesh CM urges Amit Shah to order CBI probe into Indore woman's disappearance in Meghalaya
content: The Meghalaya police, which registered a murder case after Raja's body was found, are yet to get any clues about Sonam's whereabouts

title: Rigging of polls claim: Congress to launch 'voter awareness' processions in Maharashtra
content: Mumbai Congress president Harshwardhan Sapkal alleged that BJP leaders are responding to queries directed at the EC

title: CAG figures paint a disturbing picture of Andhra Pradesh’s finances, says YSRCP president Jagan
content: As per the CAG, the State GST revenues for the first month of FY 2025-26 contracted to 24.20% when compared with that of April 2024, he says

title: 63% pass Intermediate advanced supplementary examination in Andhra Pradesh
content: All efforts have been made for correct valuation of the answer scripts, and students can apply for reverification and recounting from June 9 to 13, says BIE Secretary

title: Kisan drones revolutionalised agriculture, says A.P. MSME Minister
content: Kondapalli Srinivas urges farmers to use the drones collectively to minimise the investment in agriculture

title: Tiruchi students look beyond U.S., U.K. for overseas education
content: The availability of one-year postgraduate courses had made the U.K. a preferred destination for many Indian students and of late there has been a slowdown in demand for these courses because of rising cost

title: Andhra Pradesh Government invites Kitex Garments to invest in State’s textile sector
content: If the investment proposal materialises, it will be the company’s second biggest investment outside Kerala after Telangana

title: Will PM update his Canadian counterpart on India’s economy status: Congress takes dig at PM Modi
content: After inviting PM Modi to the G7 Summit, Canada PM Carney said that India is the “fifth-largest economy...it makes sense to invite the country to the summit”

title: Environment Minister refutes claim of Delhi Zoo ‘privatisation’
content: Bhupender Yadav says collaboration with Jamnagar-based centre part of routine conservation partnerships

title: SC residents in Kodiyalam panchayat seek road repairs, street lights for crematorium access
content: The stretch, located along the left bank of the Kodingal canal in Tiruchi district has been in a dilapidated condition for over 15 years and representations to the district administration have not yielded any result, say residents

title: BJP nominates Kanad Purkayastha for Rajya Sabha seat from Assam
content: Son of former Union Minister Kabindra Purkayastha to contest June 19 election for one of two Assam Rajya Sabha vacancies

title: Dark pattern alert: Consumer watchdog CCPA orders e-commerce platforms to self-audit on ‘deceptive’ practices
content: Based on their audit findings, platforms are encouraged to provide self-declarations confirming their sites are free from “deceptive” practices

title: ICICI Bank RM allegedly swindles ₹4.58 crore from customer accounts in Kota, loses most of it in stocks
content: Police said she had been pilfering from more than 110 accounts belonging to 41 customers for around two and a half years

title: Five Maoists gunned down in encounters in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur district
content: With the latest casualties, seven Maoists, including top leaders Sudhakar and Bhaskar, were neutralised in the operation in the last three days

title: How did celebration of RCB’s historic win in IPL spiral into chaos and crisis? | Explained
content: A stampede during RCB’s victory celebrations in Bengaluru on June 4 claimed 11 lives and left several others with injuries, turning a moment of triumph into tragedy. Facing a backlash for mismanagement and hurried planning, the Congress government in Karnataka suspended top police officials

title: Private Helicopter on way to Kedarnath crashlands on highway, all safe
content: A Kestrel Avations helicopter, an Agusta AW119, crashed on the Char Dham Yatra route, marking the fourth chopper mishap since May’s yatra began

title: Bengaluru stampede deaths: Bhaskar Rao accuses State Government of criminal negligence, says police officials made scapegoats to shield political leadership of Karnataka
content: He accused the political leadership of bowing to pressure from the BCCI and the IPL to conduct the victory parade, and said the elected government is responsible for seven crore people, and not for a few organisations or individuals

title: Election Commission of India says defaming poll panel after unfavourable verdict absurd
content: The poll panel pointed out that unsubstantiated allegations raised against the electoral rolls of Maharashtra are an affront to the rule of law.

title: Kerala rains: Light rain to continue for three more days, yellow alert for 4 districts on June 10
content: Light to moderate westerlies/north westerlies are prevailing over Kerala and Lakshadweep area in the lower tropospheric levels, according to IMD

title: Bengaluru stadium stampede: How lack of clarity on social media left RCB fans confused
content: The idea of a crowd gathering for a victory celebration had long been on fans’ mind in the event of RCB winning the final. This fantasy, coupled with RCB’s confusing announcements, led fans to believe that a victory parade was definitely going to take place

title: Kidnapping, extortion case against Kerala actor-politician G. Krishnakumar, his family
content: According to the complainant, she was kidnapped by Krishnakumar and his daughter Diya and money was extorted from her, said police

title: Allahabad HC directs restoration of Sambhal MP Zia Ur Rehman’s electricity connection
content: Allahabad High Court orders U.P. Power Corp. to restore electricity at MP’s house upon ₹6 lakh deposit

title: Partners should understand India’s zero tolerance for terror policy, not put India and Pakistan on par, says Jaishankar
content: David Lammy meets Modi, Jaishankar during 1-day visit 3 weeks after visit to Pakistan, comments on U.S., U.K. “ensuring ceasefire”

title: Proposed air enclave in Thiruvananthapuram will give a fillip to Coast Guard presence in southern region, says Coast Guard Director General
content: Coast Guard Director General S. Paramesh inaugurates new, 76.7 metre-long jetty of Coast Guard at Vizhinjam

title: Nice hosts drone shows to mark United Nations Ocean Conference
content: This drone show was organised to bring attention to the importance of ocean conservation and preservation of its marine biodiversity.

title: Economic sanctions against Pakistan via trade, visas, water are the third part of Operation Sindoor: Jay Panda
content: Jay Panda said that his delegation that visited four countries that are also members of Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), which had issued an objectionable statement post the Pahalgam terror attack, which was condemned by India, had received a positive feedback, even on the question of these economic sanctions.

title: 76 army personnel airlifted from landslide-hit Chaten in north Sikkim
content: “The air evacuation operation from Chaten has concluded today with the helicopters transporting army personnel from Chaten to Pakyong Greenfield Airport,” an official said.

title: Nine country-made bombs recovered in West Bengal's Purba Bardhaman
content: A Bomb Disposal Squad was rushed to the spot, which safely defused the bombs on the Damodar riverbed,

title: Under clear skies, thousands gather for Bakrid prayers across Hyderabad
content: Three major Idgahs in South-West zone; Hockey Ground, First Lancer and Langar Houz, witnessed sizeable gatherings, with each location drawing close to 6,000 people: DCP G. Chandra Mohan

title: Haryana delivery boy arrested in Uttar Pradesh for supplying illegal arms
content: Police recovered 10 country-made pistols, one motorcycle and cartridges from his possession in the Ramraj police station area of the district.

title: Two more persons arrested in crackdown on 'anti-nationals' in Assam
content: One person has been apprehended by Goalpara police for making "offensive social media post on Lord Ram", and another by Kamrup police for "inciting communal discord" through social media.

title: Mithi River desilting: ED summons actor Dino Morea, BMC officials
content: The notices came after the federal probe agency on Friday (June 6, 2025) searched more than 15 premises linked to these people in Mumbai in Maharashtra and Kochi in Kerala.

title: Rectify loopholes at accident spots: Kurnool Collector
content: Kurnool Collector P. Ranjith Basha appreciated the National Highways dept. for responding promptly and undertaking ₹2 crore worth works at the identified black spots to prevent accidents.

title: Himanta urges Conrad to ensure 'fair' probe by a senior officer into Assam girl's death in accident
content: The Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma on Saturday said instructions have been given for a fair and impartial inquiry into the incident

title: NIA chargesheets Maoist cadre for targeted killing of Army soldier in Chhattisgarh
content: The accused has been identified as Ashu Korsa of Bijapur in Chhattisgarh in the chargesheet filed before the NIA special court in Jagdalpur on Friday

title: Assam flood situation improves marginally, rivers showing receding trend
content: Flood waters of the Brahmaputra have inundated vast tracts of Kaziranga National Park, the UNESCO World Heritage site, while 70% of the Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary has been severely affected by the waters of the Brahmaputra and Kopili rivers.

title: Filmmaker Manish Gupta booked for injuring driver with kitchen knife
content: The incident took place on Thursday night in Mr. Gupta's residence in Sagar Sanjog building, the Versova police station official said

title: Levy of 30% interest by film financiers not usurious, says Madras High Court
content: Justice P.T. Asha rejects the contention raised by actor Vishal and directs him to pay ₹30.05 crore with 30% interest p.a. from February 2021

title: Lakshadweep MP demands rollback of ship fare hike
content: Muhammed Hamdullah Sayeed writes letter to Lakshadweep administrator Praful Patel and alleges that revision has been imposed without any public consultation, stakeholder engagement, or transparent justification

title: Passengers call Srinagar-Katra Vande Bharat a ‘great move’ to connect Kashmir with rest of India
content: Passengers also described the new service as offering ‘unmatched convenience’ making travel ‘much easier’ and ‘possible and comfortable’.

title: Bihar Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav escapes major accident in Vaishali
content: Speeding truck hit his convoy leaving three security personnel injured last night when he was returning from Madhepura, truck driver arrested.

title: Man held for giving death threat to Delhi CM Rekha Gupta
content: The accused, a fraudster who frequently changes his identity is being interrogated in the office of the force's Special Cell in northwest Delhi.

title: Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla rail link project fully operational after nearly 28 years
content: The Northern Railway said that the Banihal to Katra section has the iconic Chenab and Anji Bridge and some of the toughest and longest tunnels.

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur
content: According to an official, a militant demanded money from schools, colleges, shopkeepers and elected members in Kumbi area

title: Bengaluru stampede: Shankar and Jairam resign as secretary and treasurer of Karnataka State Cricket Association
content: In a joint statement, Shankar and Jairam said they had submitted their resignations to the KSCA president.

title: Murshidabad violence: Charge sheet filed by Bengal police against 13 in father-son murder case
content: In the aftermath of the violence, the police had arrested over 300 suspected miscreants in connection with over 60 FIRs which were lodged at various police stations in Murshidabad

title: President Murmu, PM Modi and leaders extend Eid-ul-Adha greetings
content: ‘May this occasion inspire harmony and strengthen the fabric of peace in our society, said Mr. Modi on the

title: Fire breaks out at two-wheeler showroom in Thiruvananthapuram city in Kerala
content: Around three vehicles in the showroom and possibly some in the service centre are believed to be damaged or destroyed

title: As Pawars gear up for NCP Foundation Day events, rival camps expect clarity amid reunion buzz
content: Maharashtra NCP (Sharadchandra Pawar) president Jayant Patil clarified that talk about both the factions coming together was "only in the air", and there has been no discussion on a possible reunion

title: Pakistan 'dismayed' over PM Modi's remarks in J&K over Pahalgam terror attack
content: Pakistan said it is dismayed that the Indian Prime Minister has once again chosen to accuse Pakistan of involvement in the Pahalgam attack, without presenting a single piece of credible evidence

title: India, U.S. trade talks extended as deadline looms for interim deal, sources say
content: A U.S. delegation led by senior officials from the USTR held two days of discussions in the national capital with trade officials headed by chief negotiator Rajesh Agrawal, the sources said.

title: Projects worth ₹11 crore inaugurated in 18 villages of Nellore Rural
content: The projects were undertaken on a priority basis by the local legislator Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy and completed in a record time

title: Law and order has collapsed in State, alleges Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Mr. Jagan said he was shocked and pained by the “complete collapse of law and order” under Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu’s governance

title: Germany’s Merz says he found Trump open to dialogue and committed to NATO
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz says he found President Donald Trump open to discussion and is convinced that Washington remains committed to the NATO alliance

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari accuses State of ‘suppressing’ fresh Covid data
content: Official Covid bulletins have not been released on the State Health Department website since January 28, 2023

title: Meghalaya: Missing Indore woman’s brother suspects she was abducted
content: The family of Raja Raghuvanshi, whose body was recovered from a gorge, has petitioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi for a CBI probe

title: Assamese web series spotlights NRC ‘scam’
content: The lead character is based on the man whose petition in the Supreme Court in 2009 led to the exercise of updating the citizens’ list in Assam

title: Kochi shipwreck: A sunken ship and a sea of worries
content: On May 25, a container ship sank off the coast of Kerala. While all the 24 crew members were rescued, some of the ship’s containers with hazardous cargo have either gone down with the vessel or have washed ashore. While the world worries about environmental pollution from this particular incident, John L. Paul finds that the fisher folk are more concerned about indiscriminate mining and the dumping of untreated pollutants

title: Panthers win epic double-OT Game 2: Grades, big questions for both teams
content: The series is tied heading back to Florida for Game 3. Here's how it all happened, and what comes next.

title: Judge signs settlement; colleges to pay athletes
content: Schools are now free to begin paying their athletes directly, marking the dawn of a new era in college sports brought about by a multibillion-dollar legal settlement that was formally approved Friday.

title: Panthers marvel as Marchand delivers 2OT winner
content: Brad Marchand's second goal of a thrilling Game 2 clinched a 5-4 double-overtime victory for the Panthers, evening the Stanley Cup Final at 1-1.

title: Texas bests TTU to win first NCAA softball title
content: Texas won its first NCAA softball championship Friday night, beating Texas Tech 10-4 in Game 3 of the Women's College World Series championship series in Oklahoma City.

title: Concerned McIlroy misses cut by 12 at Canadian
content: Rory McIlroy tumbled out of the RBC Canadian Open on Friday with his second-highest score to par in any PGA Tour round of his career, with Cameron Champ taking a two-stroke lead into the weekend in the final event before the U.S. Open.

title: Sources: Knicks interested in speaking with Kidd

title: MLB exec to lead new college enforcement arm

title: Sandler to cast Ravens' Henry if he rushes for 2K
content: Actor/comedian Adam Sandler has promised to cast Ravens running back Derrick Henry in a future movie if he can reach 2,000 yards rushing next season.

title: "Primary Instigators Of Violence": Meitei Alliance Asks Centre To Scrap Ceasefire With Kuki Insurgents

title: Sources: Man Utd increase offer for Mbeumo
content: Gab Marcotti reacts to Jadon Sancho's decision to return to Man United after his loan at Chelsea. (0:44) Manchester United  have upped their offer for  Brentford  forward  Bryan Mbeumo , sources have told ESPN. United have already seen the offer of an overall package of around £55 million ($74.5m) knocked back by Brentford. Sources have told ESPN that the improved offer is worth more than £60m. United are pushing to get the deal done as quickly as possible. They've already agreed to trigger the £62.5m release clause in  Matheus Cunha 's contract at Wolves. The Brazilian will formally complete his move to Old Trafford after the international break. Mbeumo, who scored 20  Premier League  goals last season, is next on Ruben Amorim's list as he looks to cure his team's goalscoring problems. According to sources, club bosses have been made aware that the 25-year-old favours a move to United despite interest from Newcastle.
